Translations.Text: (Ibrahim) said: "Then for what purpose have you have come, O messengers
They said, "We have been sent to a people who are criminals in (deep sin)—
To bring on, on them, (a shower of) stones of clay (brimstones)
Marked as from the Lord for those who trespass beyond bounds
Then We safely removed those of the believers who were there
But We did not find there any just (believing) persons except in one house
And We have left there a Sign for those who may fear the painful penalty
And in (Musa was another Sign) when We sent him to Firon (Pharaoh), with clear authority
But (Firon) turned back with his Chiefs, and said, "An (evil) magician, or a madman
So We took him and his forces, and threw them into the sea; And the blame was his
And in the ‘Ad (people, is another Sign): We sent against them the devastating Wind
It left nothing whatever that it came up against. But reduced it to ruin and decay
And in the Samood (Thamud) people (was another sign): They were told, "Enjoy (your brief day) for a little while
But they angrily defied the Command of their Lord: So the stunning and destructive noise (of an earthquake) caught them, even while they were looking on
Then they could not even stand (on their feet), nor could they help themselves
So were the people of Nuh (Noah) before them: Verily, they wickedly exceeded all limits
With Power (and Skill) did We construct the (mighty Arch of the) heaven : Verily, We are Who create the vastness of space with it
And We have spread out the (spacious) earth: How excellently We do spread out
And of everything We have created pairs: That you may remember and receive guidance
So hasten you then (at once) to Allah: Verily, from Him, I am a Warner to you, clear and open
And make no other object of worship with (Almighty) Allah: Verily, from Him, I am a Warner to you, clear and open
Like this, no messenger came to the peoples before them, but they said (of him) in like manner, an (evil) magician, or a madman
Is this the teaching they have transmitted, one to another? No! They are themselves a people breaking beyond (their) bounds
So turn away from them: Yours is not the blame
And remind (the message) truly teaching the benefits (of the Quran) to the believers
And I (Allah) have only created jinns' and men, that they may worship (and serve) Me
No sustenance do I require from them, nor do I require that they should feed Me
Verily, Allah is the All Providing (Al-Raziq) of the provision— Lord of Power— Supreme, the Almighty (Al-Matin)—
And verily, for the wrongdoers, their portion (of punishment) is like the portion of their fellows (of earlier generations): Then let them not ask Me to hasten (that portion)
Misery, then, to the unbelievers, on account of that Day of theirs which they have been promised
By (the Mountain of) Thr
And by the Book inscribed (and is carved out)
In a scroll (that is left open) unfolded
And by the frequently visited Place of Worship (the mosque for angels above Ka’bah)
And by the sky raised high
And by the ocean that fills with waves—
Surely, the (severe) penalty from your Lord will really come true—
There is no one who can change it—
On the Day when the sky will swing in terrible fear
And the mountains will fly here and there
Then woe (fear and misery), that Day to those (people) who treat (Truth) as falsehood
Those (people) who play (and indulge) in small and silly talk
That Day when they shall be pushed down to the Fire of Hell, without any questions (being asked)
This," (it will be said:) "Is the Fire— Which you habitually deny
Is this a fake, or is it you who do not see
So you burn in there, it is the same to you whether you can bear it with patience, or not: You only receive the penalty for your (own) deeds
Verily, as to the righteous (people), they will be in the Gardens, and in happiness
Enjoying the (true joy) which their Lord has given to them, and their Lord shall save them from the penalty of Fire
(It will be said to them:) "You eat and drink, with blessings and health, because of your (good) deeds
They will rest (in comfort) on Thrones (of dignity) arranged in ranks; And We shall join them to companions, with beautiful, wide and lovely eyes

And those who believe and whose families follow them in Faith— To them We shall join their families: And We shall not take away from them (the reward) of their works: (Still) each person is accountable for his deeds
And We shall provide them fruit and meat, anything that they want (to have)
There they shall exchange, one with another, a (loving) cup, free of pettiness, free of all signs of impurity
And there will go around (devoted) to them, youths (handsome) as pearls, well-guarded
They will approach one another, engaging in mutual inquiry and questioning
They will say: "Before now we were not without fear for the sake of our people
So Allah has been gracious to us, and has delivered us from the penalty of the Burning Wind
Truly, we did pray to Him from of old; Truly, it is He, the Beneficent (Al-Barr), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)
Therefore remind (mankind to celebrate the Praise of Allah). By the Grace of your Lord, you are not (any) petty-talker, and you are not a madman (nor one possessed)
Or do they say:— "A Poet! We will wait for him that some misfortune (will come) in time
You say (to them): "You wait! I will also wait among those who wait
Or do they in their capacity to understand take themselves to this (way of lying), or are they only people exceeding beyond (their) bounds
Or do they say: "He made up (the Message);" No, they have no faith
(If they can,) let them produce words (of the Message) like it, if they are telling the truth
Or were they created out of nothing? Or were they themselves the creators
Or did they create the heavens and the earth? No! They have no firm belief
Or are the treasures of your Lord with them? Or are they the tyrants to do anything they wish
Or do they have a ladder, by which they can (climb up to the heaven and) listen (to the secrets)? Then let (such a) listener of theirs come up with a clear proof
Or has He only daughters and you have sons
Or is it that you ask for a reward, so that they will be burdened with a load of debt
Or that the Unseen is in their hands, and they write it (the Suras) down
Or do they intend a plot (against you)? But those who act in disbelief (in Allah) are themselves involved in a (sinful) plot
Or have they a god other than Allah? Glorified is Allah, far above the things they associate with Him
And if they were to see a piece of the sky falling (on them), they would only say: "Clouds gathered in heaps
So leave them alone until they face their Day (of Judgment), when they shall be taken over (with fear)—
The Day when their plotting will become useless for them and no help shall be given to them
And surely, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment (in the life) before this (Day), but most of them do not understand
Now wait for the Decision of your Lord, with patience for surely, you are in Our eyes: And celebrate the Praises of your Lord the while you stand forth
And also for part of the night you praise Him— And at the setting of the stars (during the dawn)
By the Star when it goes down (and sets)—
Your Companion (the Prophet) is not in evil ways and (he is) not being misled
And he does not say (anything) from (his own) desire
It is nothing less than Revelation sent down to him
He was taught by one (Angel Gabriel, who is) mighty in power
Gifted with wisdom, because he came clearly (in a noble way from limit of understanding to High Throne of Allah)
While he was in the highest place of the horizon (in the distant skies)
Then he approached (nearer) and came closer
And was at a distance of only two bow-lengths (of spiritual union) or even nearer
Like this (Allah) brought the Revelation (and the Message) to His servant (the Prophet)— (made known) what He (wanted) to reveal
The (mind and) heart (of the Prophet) in no way lied about what he saw
Then will you disagree with him about what he saw
And indeed, he (the Prophet) truly saw him (Gabriel) as (he) came down second (time)
Near the lote-tree (a thorny but a fruit bearing tree in Middle East beyond which none may pass: Symbolically, it is the limit of human understanding)
Near it is the Garden of Abode (Allah’s Divine Presence and His Paradise)
When the lote-tree was covered (in mystic wisdom that cannot be spoken)
The (Prophet’s) vision (of Angel Gabriel) was never broken and it did not go wrong
Indeed he (the Prophet) saw, from the Signs of his Lord, the Greatest
Have you seen Al-Lat and Al-Uzza, (two forms of pagan Arabs goddesses in human forms)
And another, the third (goddess), Manat
What (silliness)! For you (yourselves) the male sex, and for Him, the female
That indeed, such a division will truly be most unjust

These are nothing (at all) except names that you have made up— You and your fathers— For which Allah has not sent down any authority (whatever). They follow nothing but their own guesswork and what their own souls wish! Even though, already there has come to them guidance from their Lord
No! Shall man have anything (just because) he wishes for it
But it is Allah to Whom the end and the beginning (of everything) belong
And there are many angels in the heavens, their pleading will be of no use except after Allah has given permission for whom He pleases and that he is acceptable to Him
Verily, those who do not believe in the Hereafter, give names to the angels that are female names
But they do not have knowledge about it. They follow nothing except (their) guesswork; And, surely, guesswork is of no use against Truth
Therefore keep away from those who turn away from Our Message and (those who) want nothing except the life of this world
That is as far as knowledge will reach them. Surely, your Lord knows best those who wander away from His Path, and He knows best those who receive guidance
And, to Allah belongs all there is in the heavens and on earth: So He rewards those who do evil, according to their actions, and He rewards those who do good, with what is best

Those who keep away from great sins and shameful deeds, only (being caught up in) small faults— Surely, your Lord is plentiful in forgiveness. He knows you well when he creates you out of the earth (your chromosomes), and when you are hidden in your mothers’ wombs. Therefore do not justify yourselves: He knows best who it is who keeps away evil
Do you see the one who turns back (from Faith)
Gives (in) a little then hardens his heart (and his feelings)
Does he have knowledge about the unseen so that he can see
No! Is he not familiar with what is in the books of Musa (Moses)—
And of Ibrahim (Abraham) who filled his promises
Namely, that no bearer of burdens can carry the burden of another
And that man can have nothing except what he works (hard) for
That (the fruit of) his work will soon come in sight
Then will he be rewarded with a complete reward
And that the final Goal is to your Lord
That it is He Who gives laughter and tears
That it is He Who causes death and gives life (again)
And that He created in pairs— Male and female
From a seed when placed (finally in the womb)
And that He has promised a second Creation (by raising the dead at Resurrection)
And that it is He Who gives wealth and satisfaction
That He is the Lord of Sirius (Shi'ra, the Mighty Star in the constellation of Canis Major)
And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) 'Ad (people) of the old
And the Samood (Thamud), and (He) did not grant them an eternal life
And before them, the people of Nuh (Noah) because they were (all) most unjust and most arrogant (people) exceeding their limits
And He destroyed the defeated Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah)
So that (soil and debris) have covered them up
Then which of the gifts of your Lord (O man) will you question
This is a warner (the Prophet), from the (number of) warners of old
The (Judgment) ever approaching comes nearer
None besides Allah, can alter (the timing of) it
Then, do you wonder at (the recitation of) this message
And will you laugh and not weep—
Wasting your time in useless things
But you fall down in prostration to Allah, and (adoringly) worship (Him)
The Hour (of Judgment) has drawn nearer, and the moon has been torn apart (cleft asunder)
And if they see a Sign they turn away, and say: "This is persistent magic
They reject (the warning) and follow their (own) desires and every matter has its appointed time
And indeed there have already come to them, recitations in which there is (enough) warning
Perfect wisdom (in this Quran)— But (the preaching of) warners does not profit them
Therefore, (O Prophet,) turn away from them. The Day when the Caller will call (them) to a terrible affair
They will come forth— Their eyes humbled—. From (their) graves, (dazed) like locusts scattered aboard
Hastening, with eyes transfixed, towards the Caller! The unbelievers will say: "Hard is this Day
Before them, the people of Nuh (Noah) rejected (their prophet): They rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!," and he was driven out
Then he called on his Lord: "I am the one overcome: Then You help (me)
So, We opened the gates of heaven, with water pouring forth
And We caused the earth to gush forth with spring so, the waters met (and rose) to the decreed level
And We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks held together with palm-fiber
She (the Ark) floated under Our eyes (and care): A reward to the one who had been rejected (with contempt by his own people)
And indeed, We have left this as a Sign (for all time): Then is there any who will receive the teachings
Then! How (terrible) was my Penalty and My Warning
And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember: Then is there any who will receive the teachings
The ‘Ad (people also) rejected (the Truth): Then! How terrible was my Penalty and My Warning
Verily, We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent disaster
Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground)
Then! How (terrible) was my Penalty and My Warning
And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember: Then is there any who will receive the teachings
The (people of) Samood (Thamud), also rejected (their) Warners
And they said: "A man! A solitary one from among ourselves! Shall we follow him? Truly, should we then be straying in mind, and mad
Is it that the Message sent to him of all people amongst us? No! He is a liar, a disrespectful one
They will know the next day, who is the liar, the disrespectful one
Verily, We will send the she-camel by the way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih) and keep yourself in patience
And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each ones right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns)
But they called to their companion (in evil) and he took a sword in hand, and killed (the she-camel cutting her hamstrings)
Then! How (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning
Verily, We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one that keeps the cattle
And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember: Then is there any who will receive the teachings
The People of Lut (Lot) rejected (his) warning
Verily, We sent against them a violent tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut's household: (And) We delivered them by early part of the morning—
As a Grace from Us: Thus do We reward those who give thanks
And (Lut) did warn them of Our punishment, but they disputed about the Warning
And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him, so, We blinded their eyes. (And they heard:) "Now you taste My Wrath and My Warning
And Verily, early on the next day an abiding punishment seized them
So you taste My Wrath and My Warning
And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember: Then is there any who will receive the teachings
Also to the People of Firon (Pharaoh), before have, came Warners (from Allah)
They (the people) rejected all Our Signs; So, We seized them with such penalty (that comes) from Almighty (Aziz, Exalted in Power), Able and Powerful (Muqtadir) to enforce His Will
Are your unbelievers, (O Quraish), better than they were or have you an immunity in the Sacred Books
Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves
Soon will their multitude be put to flight and they will show their backs
No! But the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most painful and most bitter
Truly, those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad
The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces, (it will be said:) "You taste the touch of Hell
Surely, all things We have created in proportion and measure
And Our Command is but a single (Act)— Like the twinkle of an eye
And indeed (often) in the past, We have destroyed groups like you: Then is there any who will receive the teachings
And all that they do is noted in (their) books (of deeds)
And every matter, small and large, is on record
Verily, as to those who act right, they will be in the in the midst of gardens and streams
In an Assembly of Truth, in the Presence of a Sovereign Almighty (Muqtadir, Omnipotent Allah)
(Allah;) The Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman)
It is He Who has taught the Quran
He has Created man
He has taught him to talk (and understand)
The sun and the moon that follow (their) calculated courses
And the herbs (also the term for galaxy of stars) and the trees —Both prostrate (bow) themselves in respect (to Allah)
And the Arch of the Sky — He has raised high (above), and He has set up the balance (of Justice)
So that you may not willfully overstep (the fine) balance
So establish (accurate) weight with justice and do not fall short in the balance
It is He Who has spread out the earth for (His) Creatures
In there is fruit and date-palms, producing the long leaves (enclosing dates)
Also corn, with (its) leaves and stalks for feeding the cattle and the sweet smelling plants
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both (men and jinns') renounce?—
He created man from sounding clay like the clay of pottery
And He created jinns' from a smokeless flame of fire
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
(He is the) Lord of the two easts (east and the far, far east) and the Lord of the two wests (west and the far, far west)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
(He has created) the two free streams of flowing (salt and sweet) water, meeting together
Between them is a barrier that they do not willfully overstep
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
Out of them come pearls and coral
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
And His are the ships sailing through the seas, high (and majestic) as mountains
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
All that is on earth will perish
But will remain (Alive for ever), the Face of your Lord (Rab)— Full of Majesty, Bounty and Honor, (Zhul Jalal ul Ikram)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
To Him begs (for its need) every creature in the heavens and on the earth: Every day in (new) splendor does He (shine)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
We shall soon settle your affairs— O both of you (jinns' and men)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both (jinns' and men) renounce? —
O you assembly of jinns' and men! If you can cross the zones of the heavens and the earth, then you cross (them)! (But) you shall not be able to cross, except with the authority (from Allah)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both (jinns' and men) renounce? —
On you both (the evil ones from jinns' and men)! Will be sent (both) a flame of fire (to burn) and a smoke (to choke); No defense will you have
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
When the sky is split open, and it becomes red like (molten) ointment
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
On that Day no question will be asked of man or jinn as to his sin
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
The sinners will be known by their Marks: And they will be caught by their hair and their feet
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
This is the Hell that the sinners (of this world) ignore
In the middle, and (yes) in the middle of boiling hot water will they float around
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
But for him who fears the time when they (the jinns' and men) will stand before (the Throne of Judgment of) their Lord, there will be two Gardens—
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
Containing many kinds (of trees and delights)—
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
In them (each) will be two Springs (of water) flowing (free)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
In them will be Fruits of every kind, two and two (for sufficiency and completeness)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
They will recline (and rest) on carpets whose inner lining will be of rich embroidery: The fruit of the Garden will be near, (and easy to reach)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
In them will be (maidens), chaste, restricting their glances, whom no man or jinn has ever before touched—
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
They are like Rubies and Coral
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
Is there any Reward for good — Other than good
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
And below these two, there are two other Gardens—
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
Dark-green in color (and lush with water)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
In them (each) will be two Springs with plenty of flowing water
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
In them both will be fruits and dates and pomegranates
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
In them will be fair (companions), good and beautiful—
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
Fair companions restricting (their glances), in (beautiful and decorated) homes—
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
(Companions) whom no man or jinn has ever before touched—
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
Reclining (and resting) on green cushions and rich carpets of beauty
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both (jinns' and men) renounce?—
Blessed be the Name of your Lord (Rab), Full of Majesty and Honor (Zhul-Jal-ul-Ikram)
When the Event that must occur will become a reality
Then no (soul) will have denial regarding its happening
It will bring down (many) it will raise (many others)
When the earth shall be shaken to its depths
And the mountains shall be crushed to atoms
So that they will become dust scattered around
And you shall be sorted out into three classes
Then (there will be) the companions of the right hand— What will be the companions of the right hand
And (there will be) the companions of the left hand— What will be the companions of the left hand
And those foremost (in Faith) will be foremost (in the Hereafter)
These will be those nearest to Allah
In Garden of (true) joy
A number of people from those of the old
And a few ones from those of later times
(They will be) on thrones inlaid (with gold and precious stones)
Reclining on them, face to face
Around them will (serve) youths of ever lasting (freshness)
With little glasses, (shining) tumblers, and cups (filled) from clear-flowing fountains
No ill effects will they suffer from them, and they will not be dazed
And with fruits, any that they may select
And the flesh of fowls, any that they desire
And (there will be) companions (Hu'rs) with beautiful, big and lustrous eyes—
Like (they are) pearls, well-guarded
A reward for the deeds of their past (life)
No pettiness will they hear in there, and not even a little of sinful speech (or idle talk)—
But only the saying; "Peace! Peace
And those on the right (hand)— What will be the companions of the right hand
(They will be joyful) among the (heavenly) lote-tree without thorns
Among Talh (beautifully flowering) trees with flowers (or fruits) piled one above another—
In (the) long-extended shade
By water flowing constantly
And fruit in abundance
Whose season is not limited, and (whose supply is not) stopped
And on thrones (of dignity) raised high
Verily, We have created (their companions) of special creation
And made them virgin, pure (and untouched)—
Loving (by nature), equal in age—
For the companions of the right hand
A (good) number from the first generation (in Islam)
And a (good) number from those of later generations
The companions of the left hand— What will be the companions of the left hand
(They will be) in the middle of a brutal blast of Fire and in boiling water
And in the shades of black smoke
(There will be) nothing to refresh, nothing to please
Verily, they used to indulge, before that, in wealth (and luxury)
And willfully continued in the worst wickedness
And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be Resurrected again
We and our fathers of old
Say: "Yes, verily, those of old and those of later times
All will certainly be gathered together for the meeting appointed for a well-known Day
Then surely, will you truly— O you who go wrong, and treat (Truth) as falsehood
You will surely taste of the (Evil) tree of Zaqqum
Then will you fill your insides with it
And drink boiling water on top of it
Indeed you shall drink like diseased camels raging with thirst
This will be their entertainment on the Day of Judgment
It is We Who have created you: Why will you not see (and accept) the Truth
Do you see it? The (human) seed, (the chromosomes in the sperm and ovum) that you throw out—
Is it you who created it? — Or are We, the Creator
We have ordered death to be your common ending, and We are not to be frustrated—
In changing your shapes and recreating you (again) in (shapes) that you have not known
And indeed, you certainly know already the first form of creation: Why then do you not celebrate His praises
Do you see the seed that you sow in the ground
Is it you that cause it to grow, or are We the cause
If it was Our Will, We could crumble it to dry powder, and you would be left in wondering
(Saying), "We are indeed left in debts (for no reason)
Nay! Certainly we are denied (of the fruits of our labor)
Do you not see the water that you drink
Do you bring it down (as rain) from the cloud or do We send it
If it was Our Will We verily, could make it salt (and bitter) then why do you not give thanks (to Allah)
Do you not see the Fire that you kindle
Is it you who grow the tree which feeds the fire, or do We grow it
We have made it (the fire) a monument and an article of comfort and convenience for those who live in the desert (this world)
Then celebrate with Praises the Name of your Lord (Rab), the Greatest (Al-Azeem)
Next, I swear by the setting of the Stars—
And surely, that is indeed a mighty and holy oath if you only knew—
That, this is indeed a Quran most honorable
In a Book well-guarded (with Allah)
Which none shall touch except those who are clean
A Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen)
Is it that such a Message that you would hold in light regard
And have you made it your livelihood that you should renounce it
Then why do you not (intervene) when (the soul of the dying man) reaches the throat
And you (sit) looking on—
But We are nearer to him than you, and you see not—
Then why do you not— If you are excused from (future) account.—
Return the soul, if you are truthful, (in your claim of independence)
Therefore, if he be among those nearest to Allah
(For him there is) rest and satisfaction, and a Garden of (heavenly) delights
And if he be of the companions of the right hand
(For him is the salutation); "Peace be upon you," for the companions of the right hand
And if he be of those who treat (truth) as falsehood, who go wrong
Then for him, the entertainment is with boiling water
And burning in Hell-Fire
Surely this! This is the very Truth (Haqq) and Certainty
So, celebrate with Praises the Name of your Lord (Rab), the Greatest (Al-Azeem)
All that is in the heaven and on the earth— Glorifies Allah, and He is Almighty, (Exalted in Might), All Wise
To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth: It is He Who gives life and causes death: And He is Able to do all things

He is the First (Awal) and (He is) the Last (Aakir), and the All Present, [Omnipresent, the All Evident (Za’hir)]: And (He is) the Hidden (Ba’tin), and He is the All Knower (Aleem) of all the (minutest) things

He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days, and then He rose over the Throne (of Authority). He knows what enters within the earth and what comes out of it: And what comes down from heaven and what rises up to it. And He is with you where ever you may be. And Allah sees well all that you do
To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth: And to Allah, all affairs return (for the final decision)
He merges night into day and He merges day into night; And He has complete knowledge of the secrets in the breasts (in the hearts of humans)

Believe in Allah and His Messenger and spend (in charity) out of the (sustenance) for which He has made you the inheritors. And (for those) who believe and spend (in charity), for them is a great reward

And what reason do you have? Why you should not believe in Allah? While the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord; And (He) has indeed taken your truest promise, (your covenant), if you are real believers

It is He, the One Who sends to His servant (the Prophet,) clear Signs, that He (Almighty Allah) may lead you from the depths of darkness into the Light. And surely, Allah is full of Kindness (Ra'uf), Most Merciful (Raheem)

And what reason do you have? Why you should not spend in the cause of Allah? And it is to Allah that belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who spent (freely) and fought (the wars) before the Victory (of Makkah, with those who did so later). Those are higher in rank than those who spent (freely) and fought after (the Victory). But to all has Allah promised a best (reward). And Allah is familiar with all that you do
Who is he who will lend to Allah a goodly and handsome loan? Then, He (Allah) will increase it many times to his credit, and he will (also) receive a generous reward

On the Day you shall see the believing men and the believing women— How their Light runs forward before them and by their right hands: (Their greeting will be): "Good News for you this Day! Gardens (of Paradise) beneath which flow rivers! To live in there for ever! This is indeed the highest success

On the Day the hypocrites— Men and women, will say to the believers: "Wait for us! Let us get something (a light) from your Light!" It will be said: "(You) go back to the rear! Then seek a light (where you can)!" So, a wall will be put between them, with a gate in it. Within it (the wall) will be mercy throughout, and outside and all alongside of it, will be (anger and) punishment

(Those hypocrites outside) will call the believers, "Were we not with you?" (The others) will reply, "True! But you led yourselves into temptation; You looked forward (to our destruction); And you doubted (Allah’s Promise); And (your false) desires deceived you; Until the Command of Allah became true. And the Deceiver (Satan) deceived you in respect to (Almighty) Allah
So, this Day shall no ransom be taken from you, or from those who disbelieved. Your home is Fire: That is the proper place to claim you: And it is an evil place to rest

Has not the time yet arrived for the believers, with their hearts, in all humility, should engage in the remembrance of Allah and of the Truth which has been made known (to them); And that they should not become like those to whom was given the Message before, and during long ages (that) passed over them and their hearts grew hard? And many of them are rebellious transgressors
You (who believe!) know that Allah gives life to the earth after its death! Already We have shown the Signs plainly to you. If you would only understand
Verily, those who give in charity, men and women, and loan to Allah, a beautiful loan, it shall be increased manifold (to their credit). And they shall have (besides) a generous reward

And those who believe in Allah and His messengers— They are the sincere (caretakers of Truth), and the witnesses (who testify), in the eyes of their Lord: They shall have their reward and their light. But those who reject Allah and deny Our Signs (verses), they are the companions of Hell-Fire

You (who believe!) know that the life of this world is but a play and amusement, self-praising and boasting (within yourselves), and multiplying, (in rivalry) among yourselves, riches and children. Here is a similarity— Like a rain and the growth which it brings forth, give happiness (to the hearts of) the tillers; (But) soon it withers; You will see it grow yellow; Then it becomes dry and it crumbles away. But in the Hereafter is a penalty severe (for those who follow wrong), and a Forgiveness from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure, (for those who love and worship Him). And what is the life of the world, but goods and possessions (objects) of deception

Race with one another (to be the foremost in seeking) forgiveness from your Lord, and a Garden (Paradise of Bliss), whose width is the width of heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers. That is the Grace of Allah that He bestows on whom He is pleased with: And Allah is the Owner of Gifts, great, (plentiful) and abounding
No misfortune can happen on earth or in your souls except that which is recorded in a command (written) before which We bring into existence: That is truly easy for Allah
In order that you may not be sorry over matters that pass you by, nor become overjoyed by mercies bestowed upon you; Allah does not love any petty and showy boasters— (With praise for themselves)

Such persons are stingy (with a selfish desire to own) and (they) suggest stinginess to men. And if any turn back (from Allah’s way), surely, Allah is free of all needs (Ghani), worthy of all praise (Hameed)

Indeed, We have sent Our messengers before with clear proofs and sent down with them the Book (the Scripture) and the balance (between right and wrong), that men may stand together in justice: And We sent down iron, in which is (material for) power and might (in war), as well as many benefits for mankind, that Allah may test who are those who will help Him (and His Religion), the Unseen and His messengers: Surely, Allah is Full of Strength (Qhavi), exalted in Might (Aziz, and able to enforce His Will)

And indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) and Ibrahim (Abraham) and established in their line prophet-hood and revelation: And some of them (their people) were on right guidance but many of them became rebellious transgressors

Then, afterwards, We followed them with (others of) Our messengers; And We sent after them Isa (Jesus) the son of Maryam (Mary), and gifted him the Gospel: And We placed compassion and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. But the self isolation and self-denial (practiced by monks in monasteries) which they made up for themselves, We did not place it upon them: (We commanded) only the seeking for the good Pleasure of Allah: But that they did not continue it as they should have done. So, We blessed, on those among them who believed, their (due) reward, but many of them are rebellious transgressors

O you who believe! Fear Allah, and believe in His Messenger, and He will bless on you with twice the portion of His Mercy: And He will provide for you a light by which you shall walk (straight in your path), and He will forgive you (for your past): And Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

That the People of the Book may know that they do not have any power over the Grace of Allah, that (His) Grace is (entirely) in His Hand, to (grant) it on anyone He wills. For Allah is the Owner of Gifts, great, (plentiful) and abounding
